column4: Hello guys. I've got problems with my microSd card. Ubuntu recognize it normaly but drive doesn't have write support. How can I format it to fat and add write support? Please help!
does the microSD adaptor have the write tab to the lock position? Also, check out the disk utility for formatting
No. Write tab isn't on lock position. How can I do it vith gparted?
what version of ubuntu are you running?
goto system, adminstration, disk utility - that will be how you format
I see now that drive is alredy in fat 16, so how can I add write support now?
what size is the card?
2GB
Ubuntu only
Are you still here?
still here
So what should I do?
I would reformat as Ext 3 or 4, since you are only using it in ubuntu
yes but than I don't know if my phone will recognize it
Ah, what phone do you have? thought you were only using in ubuntu
LG t329
the best way to do that, if you need it to work in your phone, is to format it *from* your phone - then try it in ubuntu.
LG T310
I was doing even that but still won't works
well try to just format it as FAT then in ubuntu, and see if it works in both
